title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.16.22 | 29-01-2023
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.text: Om Agyana Timiraandhasya Gyananjanishalakaya Chakshurunmeelitam Yena Tasmai Shri Gurave Namaha
Namah Om Vishnupadaya Krishna Preshtaya Bhutale Shri Mate Bhaktivedanta Swamin Nithinamine
Namaste Saraswate Deve Gauravani Pracharine Nirvishesha Shunyavadi Pashchatyade Shatarine
Jaya Shri Krishna Chaitanya Prabhu Nithyananda Shri Advaita Gadadhara Shiva Sadhi Gauravakta Vrinda
Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
Om Namo Bhagavate Vasudevaya Narayanam Namaskritya Naram Chai Vanarottamam
Deveem Saraswateem Vyasam Tato Jayam Udi Rayet
In this session we will be discussing
from the 22nd verse of the 16th chapter of the 1st canto of Srimad Bhagavatam
The 22nd verse is as follows
Kim Chhatra Bandhun Kalinopa Srishtan
Rashtrani Vaatair Avaropitani
Itas Tato Vasana Pana Vasaha
Snana Javayon Mukha Jeevalokam
The meaning of this verse is
The so-called administrators are now bewildered by the influence of this age of Kali
and thus they have put all state affairs into disorder
Are you now lamenting this disorder?
Now the general populace does not follow the rules and regulations
for eating, sleeping, drinking, mating etc.
and they are inclined to perform such any business
whether they are staying in their inner community
that they have been advised by God
how to behave in this global and철
they have too muchη
to stay in them
to live anyway
How can one save himself?
how to take care of one's life,
every life in the world?

State affairs are in disorder. There is no proper law and order situation prevailing, which was the, which was the law and order was much, much better in the earlier ages.

There were very strong administrators, the kings, and they had excellent administration. So things were very much well maintained. But now, due to the influence of Dejav Kali, there is disorder in the state affairs.
